metadata.title: CVE-2018-19046 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
keepalived 2.0.8 didn't check for existing plain files when writing data toa temporary file upon a call to PrintData or PrintStats. If a localattacker had previously created a file with the expected name (e.g.,/tmp/keepalived.data or /tmp/keepalived.stats), with read access for theattacker and write access for the keepalived process, then this potentiallyleaked sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19046` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

keepalived - 1:2.0.10-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: keepalived package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.0.10-1').
